description: Productive fuelbreaks (PFb) are interventions in the territory aimed at reducing the risk of wildfires in high-risk areas. This objective is achieved through the economic exploitation (agricultural, livestock, forestry, or mixed) of the intervened surface, whose maintenance and production help to slow the spread of fire by reducing the fuel and its continuity. Additionally, the presence of farmers, livestock breeders, resin collectors, gatherers, etc., increases forest surveillance and early fire detection, complementing conventional suppression infrastructures.
